chargeHist.descr: Felony Murder- While attempting to Commit Armed Robbery

result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder-While Attempting to Commit Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Surcharges applicable.  In amount of $2,448.29:  payable as follows:  $1,393.39 to Crime Victim Compensation, and $1,054.90 to Donna G.    Joint and several with Davontay Ballinger 14CF1666.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court imposed applicable fees, assessments, restitution, Court costs and surcharges including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77
DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in Secs. 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control. Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision/when sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance. Collection can then proceed under Sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
*7/24/2020  Honorable Stephanie G. Rothstein signed ORDER:  Defendant is granted 10 days additinal sentence credit for a total of 754 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Undergo a mental health evaluation. Comply with any treatment.
AODA assessment. Follow through with recommended programming.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 YEARS, with credit for 744 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

The court rejects defense probation recommendation.
Defendant to undergo a mental health evaluation and comply with any treatment
*AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming; 
*Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Restitution (surcharges applicable) in the amount of $2448.29 joint and several with codefendant.
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments,  restitution, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

SAME APPEARANCES.
At the hour of 1:43 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of Guilty which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court granted states bail motion for REMAND. Prior PSI to be used for sentencing.

Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Trial resumed at 9:20 am. Court continues jury instructions. Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:30 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Spotek and Sanfelipo who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

SAME APPEARANCES.
Trial resumed at 1:39 pm. Exhibit 18, 20-21. Sworn for the state: Davontay B. (continued testimony), MPD Detective Shelonda Tarer. State rests. Defense moves for directed verdict.  Court denies defense motion. Sworn for defense: MPD Detective James Henner, Terry Blunt. Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: MPD Detective Matthew Bell. Court gives jury instructions. Jurors released for the day at 4:30 pm.  Jurors to return at 8:30 am on 2.4.16.

SAME APPEARANCES.
Trial resumed at 9:35 am. Exhibit 19. Sworn for the state: MPD Detective Scott Schmitz (continued testimony), Corren M., Davontay B. Jurors released for lunch at 11:45 am.

Voir Dire continued at 9:23 am.

State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case set for motion hearing. At the last court date defense counsel  made an oral motion to allow the defendant to withdraw his plea entered into on 2/16/15. Court GRANTED defense counsel's request for reasons stated on the record. Discussion regarding defense counsel's motion to withdraw. Court GRANTED defense motion. Attorney Wright will turnover the contents of his file to the Public Defender's Office. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Case set for sentencing hearing. PSI writer Dana Janik-Lemke and DOC Supervisor Patricia Beyer-Robinson also present in court. Discussion regarding defendant's statements to the PSI writer. Defendant sworn in. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Defense counsel made oral motion to allow the defendant to withdraw his plea for reasons stated on the record. Court denied defense motion at this time. Court ordered this matter set for a hearing on defense motion to withdraw plea. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNT 2 as AMENDED-
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Court ordered a presentence investigation WITHOUT a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. Parties to file sentencing materials by 4/14/15.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.

Case set for final pretrial. Branch 25 is unable to hear this matter today. Parties are prepared to proceed to trial. No pending pretrial issues remain. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 12/02/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Edward Lee Wright in court, defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for this hearing. State does not intend to file a motion for joinder with the co-defendant's cases (14CF1647 & 14CF1666). Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Any motions to be filed by 8/18/14. Motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt in court with attorney William Sulton for Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #09CF2862 that are attached to the complaint.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Detective Charles Mueller.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt not in court, defendant in custody.  
Attorney Edward Wright, representing the defendant, called the Court at approximately 9 a.m. to inform the Court that he was not be able to appear in Court for today's proceedings.  ADA Grant Huebner, appearing in this matter for Antoni Apollo for the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt in court with attorney Robert E Webb on behalf of Edward Wright.  Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for competency hearing. Defense maintains his challenging of the doctor's report. Court ordered testimony be taken. Sworn for the State: Dr. Robert Rawski. State rests. Defense rests. Testimony closed. Additional arguments heard as to defendant's competency. Court finds the defendant competent to proceed. This matter needs to be sent back to preliminary court for a preliminary hearing. Defense counsel put the State on notice he will request to argue bail at the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Amended Witness List, received and filed.
Proposed verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions with attachments received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt in court with attorney Edward L Wright.  Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for return on doctor's report. Court reviewed the opnion of Dr. Rawski finding the defendant competent to proceed. State does not challenge the report. Defendant is challenging the findings and requests a competency hearing. Defense counsel will have someone from his office cover this matter as he is unavailable for all other dates the court offered. Certified copy of prior conviction in case 09CF2862 received and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Doctor's report received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt in court with attorney Edward L Wright.  Defendant Terry Tyrone Blunt in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders Defendant to be kept separate from Co-Defendants Davontay Ballinger and Corren Mattox.
